title: Neil Woodford could face legal challenge from angry investors
text:
Angry investors who fell victim to the collapse of Neil Woodford’s business will “inevitably” sue the disgraced fund manager, top City lawyers said.

Savers are widely expected to take legal action against Mr Woodford in a bid to recoup losses after the shocking failure of his empire, with lawyers preparing to offer their services to those affected.

Mr Woodford's flagship Equity Income Fund is being wound up after investing in a string of risky, hard to sell stocks, leaving hundreds of thousands of customers facing potential losses as high as 40p in the pound.

Clive Zietman, head of commercial litigation at Stewarts - a law firm involved in high-profile shareholder cases against RBS and Tesco...
